content: Oh
ancient mossy stone grass hey crackers let me show you how to make
a super easy stone bridge so I started out with just a piece of cardboard and a
piece of foam core with the paper backing removed and what I did is I
detailed the foam core with the ink pen and just dragged it through the foam
core I did a lot of kind of dilapidation and cracks and that kind of thing into
the foam core because I want it to be like kind of a crumbling bridge right
then I glued it to the cardboard and I've been in just a bit a little bit and
I put hot glue in the corrugations of the cardboard that'll make it so that
bridge will stay in that shape so pretty cool so here's another picture of it all
set up and you can see the nice curve we got going on there now I added some
white glue to this and that'll cover it up so when I spray paint it it won't
melt the styrofoam right the next thing I did was I added some pencil shavings
soaked in white glue and this will give some nice Moss to the final product so
basically I just painted this up with some stone texture painted the moss
green and let's go the table I'll show you what that looks like so here we go
here's a full glory of the bridge I think it looks really great just a super
simple easy project and coming up to this gate here and I'm going to show
these crafts here real soon so take care have fun crafting
perjurer now you lookin ish let me out of here I
don't want to be trapped in this picture forever Satan I expel the other it is
